results.name: Write n in binary, then increase each run of 0's by one 0. a(n) is the decimal equivalent of the result.
comment: A171598 and A171599 give record values and where they occur. (End)
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = if n<2 then n else 2*(1 + 0^((n+2) mod 4))*a([n/2]) + n mod 2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 20 2010
example: 12 in binary is 1100. Increase each run of 0 by one digit to get 11000, which is 24 in decimal. So a(12) = 24.
